guide_overview.title: Order Types in Trading
guide_overview.introduction: For the price formation process in various trading forms, two basic order types are permitted.

basic_order_types.definition: These are unlimited buy or sell orders that should be executed at the next possible price determination.
key_characteristics: Used when the order needs to be executed as quickly as possible
Executed at the best available current market price
basic_order_types.use_case: Traders use market orders when the order should be executed as quickly as possible.

basic_order_types.definition: These are buy or sell orders that should be executed at the specified price limit or better.
key_characteristics: The price limit allows the market participant to define the maximum price they are willing to pay (for buys) or the minimum price they are willing to accept (for sells)
Offers price certainty but no execution guarantee
Order only executes if the specified price or better is available
basic_order_types.use_case: Used when price is more important than immediate execution.

advanced_order_types.definition: This order is only entered into the order book when the stop price limit is reached and is then executed like a market order.

variations.name: Stop Buy Order
variations.scenario: When buying a stock with a Stop Market Order above the current price
variations.execution: The order is triggered when the price is reached and the stock is automatically bought at the next possible price.
variations.purpose: With Stop Buy Orders, one attempts to follow the trend by buying the security during rising prices.

variations.name: Stop Loss Order
variations.scenario: When selling a stock with a Stop Market Order below the current price
variations.execution: The order is triggered when the price is reached and the stock is automatically sold at the next possible price.
variations.purpose: Stop Loss Orders are used by traders to limit losses in open positions and/or to secure profits.

advanced_order_types.important_note: There is no guarantee that an order triggered by the stop price will be executed.

advanced_order_types.definition: With this order, when the stop limit is reached, the order is not entered as a market order but as a limit order into the order book.

example.scenario: Example of a Stop Limit Order to buy with a stop limit of 101 and an execution limit of 102
execution_flow: When price reaches 101, a buy order with execution limit 102 is automatically placed
If the price has meanwhile risen above 102, the limit order will not be executed

key_characteristics: Combines features of stop orders and limit orders
The limit order will not be executed at the next price determination if:
- For Stop Buy Orders: the next price is above the price limit
- For Stop Loss Orders: the next price is below the price limit

execution_guarantee.price_based: Limit Order & Stop Limit Order (only at specified price or better)

practical_application.risk_management_note: Stop orders are crucial for risk management but do not guarantee execution, especially in fast-moving or gapping markets.
practical_application.liquidity_consideration: Market orders work best in liquid markets; in illiquid markets, they may result in unfavorable prices.
practical_application.strategy_integration: Different trading strategies require different order types - scalpers often use market orders, while swing traders may prefer limit orders.
